alert.note: Alert for Cambria; Clearfield (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 07 at 5:48AM EDT until May 08 at 4:01AM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM EDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Cambria and Clearfield. * WHEN...Until 1045 AM EDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Small streams and creeks are elevated near bankfull levels and may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 540 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated 1 to 2 inches of rain have fallen over the advisory area, resulting in minor flooding in poor drainage areas and along some small streams and creeks. - Additional rainfall of 0.5 to 0.75 inches is expected through the afternoon. This additional rain will continue to produce minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Johnstown, DuBois, Clearfield, Westmont, Windber, Ebensburg, Belmont, Nanty-Glo, Portage, Sandy, Northern Cambria, Philipsburg, Woodland, Curwensville, Geistown, Southmont, Patton, Cresson, Gallitzin and Penfield. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
